title: platinumsteel2016
author: platinumsteel2016
content: Do anyone know of any jewelers that sell diamonds for btc ?  I am in the United States.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: I'm not live in Unites States and I don't have any relation with this site, but I found this store is accept Bitcoin [1] maybe you can go to one of their store and ask if you can sell your jewels. However you can also sell it in this forum, but posting it on Goods section, although it may be hard since you need to find a person who willing to buy it and you must use escrow. [1] https://americancoinsandgold.com/blog/buy-sell-trade-for-bitcoin/

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: Same like Despairo im not living in the US but after I google it there is actually jewelers & watch can be buy using bitcoin by using bitpay provider https://bitpay.com/directory/jewelry-watches/ there is list on it maybe one of them is can be shipped in the US or have offline store in the United States

comments.author: KennyR
comments.body: Going through the Web found this jewellery store crmjewelers located in Florida. Maybe you can try this, and at the end of the page it is possible to see the list of payments accepted. There Bitcoin too is added. Op can check with them. This can help your purchase of gold jewellery with bitcoin.

comments.author: slaman29
comments.body: Or the other thing you can do is call up the jeweler you like, who has the product you want, and ask if they accept BTC? You never know.These aren't cheap products, and most dealers of luxury items as I know will be very happy to discuss alternative modes of payment for getting new business

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: I am sure you can find a few.REEDS Jewelers is one shop I found without any problems:https://www.reeds.com/bitcoin.htmlGray & Sons Jewelers in Miami also accepts Bitcoin:https://www.grayandsons.com/bitcoinThere is also a merchant in New York called Since1910:https://www.since1910.com/bitcoinYou can find a list of jewelry merchants that accept crypto on BitPay's site. Although I wouldn't suggest using that payment processor but that's a different story:https://bitpay.com/directory/jewelry-watches/Google it. That's the easiest way to find what you are looking for. Try "buy jewelry for bitcoin USA" or a more specific key phrase that corresponds more to your geographical location. You can even check with local shops if they are willing to take bitcoin. Even if they aren't advertising it over official channels, they might be interested.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: If none of the other options given so far work for you there are a lot of places that sell gift cards https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5208530.0 some of the stores they sell cards for also sell jewelry. Not sure if any of them sell what you are looking for but it's an option.You did not say where you are in the US, but you can also check here: https://coinmap.org and see if there are any places near you.There is also the goods section on the board here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=51.0 every once in a while a diamond shows up: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5405986.0-Dave
